translated: “Standing in the middle of the deep,

analyzed: i t ca ayasmā kappo  oghe jāte mahat bhaye
translated: (so said the venerable Kappāyana)🔽In the great fear of the flood,
For those who are carried away by old age and death,
Please teach the island, dear sir;
You should explain the island to me,

analyzed: yathā ayi idam na aparam siyā
translated: So that this will not happen again.”
“Standing in the middle of the deep,

analyzed: kappāti bhagavā  oghe jāte mahat bhaye
translated: (Kappāyana said the Fortunate One)🔽In the great fear of the flood,
For those who are carried away by old age and death,

analyzed: dīpam pabrūmi te  akiñcanam an ādāna
translated: I teach the island to you, Kappāyana.
The one without possessions, the one without grasping,🔽This is the island, there is no other;
The destruction of old age and death.
Those who, knowing this, are mindful,

analyzed: diṭṭhadhamma abhinibbutā  na te māravasā anugā
translated: Are emancipated right in the here and now;🔽They are not subject to Māra,
They are not subject to the wandering on (the cycle of rebirth).
The Questions of Kappāyana is the tenth.
